item.title: Computational problem
item.description: Computational problem # A computational problem is (usually) specified as: a set of possible inputs, and the expected outputs (for these inputs). Problem vs algorithm # For instance, here is a problem that you may have encountered already: Input: a sorted array A of integers, an integer a Output: true if a appears in A, false otherwise There are (infinitely) many algorithms that can solve this problem. But some of them are more efficient than others.
